Package: org.grails.datastore.mapping.simpledb

[Java] Class SimpleDBDatastore

      • org.grails.datastore.mapping.simpledb.SimpleDBDatastore
      • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
        InitializingBean, Listener

        public class SimpleDBDatastore
extends AbstractDatastore

        A Datastore implementation for the AWS SimpleDB document store.

        Authors:
        Roman Stepanenko based on Graeme Rocher code for MongoDb and Redis
        Since:
        0.1

        • Methods Summary

            Methods 
            Type Name and description
            void afterPropertiesSet()
            protected void analyzeAssociations(PersistentEntity entity)
            Analyzes associations and for those associations that need to be stored in a dedicated AWS domain, creates info object with details for that association.
            protected void createEntityDomainResolver(PersistentEntity entity)
            protected void createEntityIdGenerator(PersistentEntity entity)
            protected Session createSession(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String> connDetails)

            protected java.lang.String generateAssociationDomainName(Association<?> association)
            protected AssociationKey generateAssociationKey(Association<?> association)
            SimpleDBAssociationInfo getAssociationInfo(Association<?> association)
            If the specified association has a dedicated AWS domains, returns info for that association, otherwise returns null.
            java.lang.String getDomainNamePrefix()
            If specified, returns domain name prefix so that same AWS account can be used for more than one environment (DEV/TEST/PROD etc).
            SimpleDBDomainResolver getEntityDomainResolver(PersistentEntity entity)
            Returns domain resolver for the specified entity.
            SimpleDBIdGenerator getEntityIdGenerator(PersistentEntity entity)
            Returns id generator for the specified entity.

            void persistentEntityAdded(PersistentEntity entity)

            Parameters:

          • public java.lang.String getDomainNamePrefix()

            If specified, returns domain name prefix so that same AWS account can be used for more than one environment (DEV/TEST/PROD etc).

            Returns:
            null if name was not specified in the configuration
